Title: Earth isn’t the only planet with seasons, but they can look wildly different on other worlds
Description: The rotational axis that Earth spins on, along the North and South poles, isnt quite aligned with the vertical axis perpendicular to Earths orbit around the Sun.That slight tilt has big implications for everything from seasons to glacier cycles. Spin-orbit resonances can cause these obliquity variations, which is when a planet wobbles on its axis.
